sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Probably the easiest way to store mixer levels is to set and retrieve them using a bootscript.
Install the init script /etc/rc.d/init.d/alsa included in the package.
Note that all channels of your sound card are muted by default. You can use the alsamixer program from ALSA Utilities (or any other OSS mixer) to change this.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The ALSA Utilities package contains aconnect, alsactl, alsamixer, amixer, aplay, arecord and aseqnet.

sect3.title: aconnect
sect3.para: aconnect is a utility for connecting and disconnecting two existing ports in the ALSA sequencer system.

sect3.title: alsactl
sect3.para: alsactl is used to control advanced settings for the ALSA sound card drivers.

sect3.title: alsamixer
sect3.para: alsamixer is an ncurses-based mixer program for use with the ALSA sound card drivers.

sect3.title: amixer
sect3.para: amixer allows command-line control of the mixers for the ALSA sound card drivers.

sect3.title: aplay
sect3.para: aplay is a command-line soundfile player for the ALSA sound card drivers.

sect3.title: arecord
sect3.para: arecord is a command-line soundfile recorder for the ALSA sound card drivers.

sect3.title: aseqnet
sect3.para: aseqnet is an ALSA sequencer client which sends and receives event packets over a network.
